Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Factors associated with the development of fulminant hepatic failure were female sex ( OR = 25 ; 95 % CI : 4 . 1 - 151 ; P < . 0001 ) , hepatocellular damage ( OR = 7 . 9 ; 95 % CI : 1 . 6 - 37 ; P < . 009 ) , and higher baseline plasma bilirubin value ( OR = 1 . 15 ; 95 % CI : 1 . 09 - 1 . 22 ; P < . 0001 ) .

Let's think step by step.

Explanation:

The paragraph mentions "fulminant hepatic failure" as one of the factors associated with a certain development. Therefore, "fulminant hepatic failure" is the only disease entity in the paragraph.

Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Factors associated with the development of fulminant hepatic failure were female sex ( OR = 25 ; 95 % CI : 4 . 1 - 151 ; P < . 0001 ) , hepatocellular damage ( OR = 7 . 9 ; 95 % CI : 1 . 6 - 37 ; P < . 009 ) , and higher baseline plasma bilirubin value ( OR = 1 . 15 ; 95 % CI : 1 . 09 - 1 . 22 ; P < . 0001 ) .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| plasma bilirubin |

Explanation:

The only chemical entity mentioned in the paragraph is "plasma bilirubin". It is a type of bilirubin, which is a yellow-orange substance produced by the liver when it breaks down old red blood cells. Therefore, it is a chemical entity and is presented as "plasma bilirubin" in the table.
